alert.note: Alert for Christian; Todd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 12:40PM EDT until August 27 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Christian County in south central Kentucky... Todd County in south central Kentucky... * Until 130 PM CDT. * At 1140 AM CDT, At 1137 AM CDT, Todd County Emergency Management flooding beginning to affect roadways...with Highway 79 at Guthrie and Highway 104 at Trenton starting to top with water. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elkton, Guthrie, Pembroke, Trenton, and Allensville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
